sentences.sContent: Mathew picked up the cup and sipped his coffee.
sentences.sCn: 马修拿起杯子抿了口咖啡。

sentences.sContent: She put her cup and saucer down on the table.
Breakfast consisted of half a cup of milk and a dry biscuit.
sentences.sCn: 早餐是半杯牛奶和一片干饼干。

sentences.sContent: The president of the club came to present the cup to the winners.
sentences.sCn: 俱乐部主席来给获胜者颁发奖杯。

sentences.sContent: ...many students could hardly stay awake in his class without first drinking a cup of coffee...
...Then he gets around them to make him a cup of tea...
...How about joining me for a cup of coffee...

phrases.pCn: n. 命运；心爱之人或物
一杯咖啡的时间；短暂逗留
n. 戴维斯杯（国际网球赛）
茶杯，转转茶壶；供应茶杯

words.tran: 用吸器放血者，用杯吸法者
用杯盛；使成杯状（cup的ing形式）

trans.tranOther: a small round container, usually with a handle, that you use to drink tea, coffee etc
